text: Hi, We would like to change the template of our blog. How is possible to do some tests without change the main blog? We would like to have something like the Content Staging. Or at least, how is possible to disable the domain stylesheet for a blog?
you can use the template preview, but for more complicated changes you’ll want to create a test blog, assign it too use the new template, copy some posts over from another blog
but if I create a new test blog, it will use the domain stylesheet, and I can't use the new template; because some rules will be active
Awesome, thanks so much! :slightly_smiling_face:
{% include 'asldfk' %} caused error.
How can I fix this?
this caused after I upgraded the module version.

<@UETH1SULA> <https://designers.HubSpot.com/transitioning-from-v1-to-v2-modules>
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/modules/reference#restricted-hubl>

Includes are not allowed in custom modules
On v1 it was working.
But after upgrade, it shows error.
How can I solve this problem <@U7SL518D6>?

read the articles I linked to. generally if there’s a real reason for you to be using an include inside a custom module, you’re likely doing something in a way that you probably shouldn’t anyway. there is only 1 scenario that I see using an include in a custom module as truly necessary, and even then there are work-arounds.

got a problem importing a css file into another css file. for some reason a macro from the imported file is erroring through when I use
`{% import "SC_-_Framework/CSS/Company-Globals.css" %} `

yet when i use the exact same import function it pulls through in another css file without errors.

Because of it I can’t publish my css file. any ideas?
I hate to be a bother but i feel like this could be related to the recent changes to error messages and whatnot? seems like a false alarm, but it’s preventing me from publishing
Can you send me a link to the template

seeing an issue that could be related - not sure. I’m getting an error showing in my file for a macro which is defined in an imported file. another file with the same import script is able to use the macro fine without issue.
<https://spin.d.pr/lnGgyh+>

I can link you to both files
looks like you found my other thread
yep DMing
<https://github.com/HubSpot/jinjava/pull/300>
These suggestions helped a lot! I was able to figure it out and now it's doing exactly what I need it to do. :tada:
Random question for everyone. Is there a way to password protect pages / content with an authentication module, or members in HubSpot?
I thought I saw a newer feature that was referred to as membership, but I could not seem to find all of the information I was looking for
<https://www.HubSpot.com/product-updates/create-membership-content-using-marketing-hub>
ahhhh, I think that is what I am looking for.
Thanks so much!
